Key Match Events: Lebanon took the game to a China side who looked shaky each time they came under pressure
Wu Lei took advantage of a loose ball from defender Nour Mansoor to set up Lui Bin Bin but the latter’s effort was punched away by Lebanese custodian Mostafa Matar
Dai Weijun forced Matar into action moments later, with the custodian needing two attempts to deny the China number 9
Hasan Matouk’s right footed shot from outside the box was denied by the crossbar
Zhang Linpeng’s header from the centre of the box having to be parried away
Hasan Srour’s right-footed shot from outside the box was fisted away by Junling
Maher Sabra’s dangerous header from defender was fisted away by Junling
Wu Lei’s shot from inside the six yard box was denied by Srour
Post-Match Reflections: Both teams having much to do on Matchday Three if they are to advance to the Round of 16
Lebanon’s first point with both teams having much to do on Matchday Three if they are to advance to the Round of 16
China will face hosts Qatar on Monday while Lebanon will cross swords with debutants Tajikistan
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at the Al Thumama Stadium on Wednesday
The result took China PR to two points
